title: Exclusive: Small newspapers get Govt ads worth crores under BJP Government: NewsLaundry
selftext:
While the government has been surely keeping big media under control, I have a feeling that even small publishers in print media are paid to keep them loyal to the ruling party.

The story is under paywall but you can get an idea of what is going on.

[https://www.newslaundry.com/2023/05/31/small-newspapers-but-with-govt-ads-worth-crores-its-nine-years-of-narendra-modi](https://www.newslaundry.com/2023/05/31/small-newspapers-but-with-govt-ads-worth-crores-its-nine-years-of-narendra-modi)
comments:
How bad can it get if every small and big publisher is either paid or threatened. I am just wondering that only few online platforms would remain unbiased.

And, they also have IT Cell and troll army to deal with online dissent. And, they can also promote some YouTube channels and websites to push their agenda.

Also according to Newslaundry, these newspapers don't even qualify the norms for publishing Govt advertisements. The owner of one such newspaper is actually a relative of the BJP workers. 

Newslaundry also provided detailed research into their editorials which are blatantly plagiarised from other newspapers .....
When government supports you and you support government, you feel you are above the law.
It's black to white conversion, this money is often returned as donation or electoral bonds
